column4: Hi, I am facing a weird problem in my ubuntu 10.04, on startup the windows borders are missing and windows come up at the left side corner only, I can't move, close, minimise or maximise them. The only fix I have found is every startup I go to System -> Preferences -> Appearance -> Visual Effects I select Extra and then it comes back to normalcy
anyone ?
For some reason your window manager isn't starting, or is crashing, at login.
which is the window manager, how do I check it ?
at startup btw the Visual Effects go to 'None' automatically
When you have desktop effects selected the window manager is "compiz", when you have it set to none the window manager is "metacity".
I have compiz installed
how do I check what's wrong with compiz ?
any tips ?
What happens if you go back to none? Do your window borders go away again?
nope
I think compiz is crashing or something in the startup as you said...should I reinstall it ?
Could you file a bug report with "ubuntu-bug compiz"?
ok i'll check that
wow! I didn't know filing bugs was that easy
so I have now filed a bug...
What's the link to the bug? It should contain usefull logs.
https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/625112
any clue ?
No, sorry.
np
in your opinion, will reinstalling compiz make any difference ?
I wouldn't expect it to, but it can't hurt to try.
